welcome-page.description1: {{brandname}} is an in-memory data store that offers scalability, interoperability, and fault tolerance.
welcome-page.description2: Use high-performance caching capabilities and create distributed data grids designed for microservice architectures.
welcome-page.connect: Connect to {{brandname}} clusters with remote clients.
welcome-page.develop: Code applications for different use cases.

support.no-user-text: You must enter credentials to access the console. Create a username and password to continue.
support.text-create-user: Create a username and password then reload.
support.text-command: bin/cli.sh user create myuser -p changeme -g admin

cache-managers.title: Data container
cache-managers.no-caches-body: Select "Create a cache" and provide configuration in XML, JSON, or YAML format or use a custom template. You can also create caches from the CLI and remote clients.
cache-managers.no-counters-body: Create counters with the CLI or a remote client.
cache-managers.no-tasks-body: Create tasks with the CLI or a remote client.

rebalancing.modal-description: Temporarily disable only to avoid repeated cluster rebalancing operations when restarting a node or adding multiple nodes. Always enable cluster rebalancing as soon as possible to prevent data loss.

create.cache-name-help: Enter a unique name for your cache.
create.cache-name-help-invalid: You must specify a unique name for each cache.
create.configuration-help: Enter valid configuration in XML, JSON, or YAML format. You can use the distributed cache for demonstration purposes.
create.configuration-help-invalid: Cache configuration must be valid and conform to the schema.
create.templates-help: Create caches from a custom template.

getting-started.cache-name: 1. Enter a unique name for your cache.
getting-started.cache-type: 2. Choose how to create your cache.
getting-started.cache-type-radio1-helper: Build a cache with guided steps.

edit-config.template-help-invalid: Select a template or enter a configuration

basic.topology-tooltip: Select the topology of the clustered cache.
basic.number-owners-tooltip: Number of owners of the cache.

advanced-options.page-subtitle: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit.
advanced-options.locking-subtitle: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit.
advanced-options.lock-acquisition-timeout-tooltip: Lock acquisition timeout of the cache.

configuration.title: Available cache templates
configuration.no-templates-body: Add cache templates to the server configuration.
configuration.no-encoding-warning: This cache either has no encoding configuration or uses an encoding that the console does not support. You must use Hot Rod clients to perform read and write operations on this cache.
configuration.no-encoding-docs: See "Cache Encoding and Marshalling" in the documentation.

entries.modal-clear-body-line-one: This action will permanently clear all entries in
entries.modal-delete-body-line-one: This action will permanently delete the key
entries.modal-delete-body-line-three: You can always recreate the entry after.
entries.add-entry-maxidle-invalid: Max idle must be a number
entries.add-entry-maxidle-help: If you set a negative value, the entry is never deleted.
entries.add-entry-lifespan-invalid: Time to live must be a number.
entries.add-entry-lifespan-help: If you set a negative value, the entry is never deleted.
entries.add-entry-form-key-tooltip: The key can contain JSON or Protobuf values, depending on cache encoding.
entries.add-entry-form-value-tooltip: The value can contain JSON or Protobuf values, depending on cache encoding.
entries.add-entry-form-lifespan-tooltip: Sets the number of seconds before
entries.add-entry-form-maxidle-tooltip: Sets the number of seconds that entries can be idle.

query.modal-button-query-clear-stats-body: All query statistics in this cluster will be removed.

rebalancing.modal-description: Disabling rebalancing prevents the cluster from repairing data in this cache belonging to nodes leaving the cluster. It should be re-enabled as soon as possible to prevent possible data-loss in this cache.

availability.modal-available-description: will become available for read and write operations.

cache-metrics.average-reads-tooltip: Average time, in milliseconds, for read operations to complete.
cache-metrics.average-writes-tooltip: Average time, in milliseconds, for write operations to complete.
cache-metrics.average-deletes-tooltip: Average time, in milliseconds, for delete operations to complete.
cache-metrics.data-access-hits-info: Hits displays the number of successful requests for cache entries.
cache-metrics.data-access-misses-info: Misses displays the number of times that a client requested an entry that was not in the cache. Misses occur when an entry is never stored in the cache or after an entry is evicted from the cache.
cache-metrics.data-access-stores-info: Stores displays the number of write operations that put entries in the cache.
cache-metrics.data-access-retrievals-info: Retrievals displays the number of read operations that get entries from the cache.
cache-metrics.data-access-remove-hits-info: Remove hits displays the number of successful requests to delete cache entries.
cache-metrics.data-access-remove-misses-info: Remove misses displays the number of times that a client attempted to delete an entry that was not in the cache.
cache-metrics.data-access-evictions-info: Evictions displays the number of entries that have been evicted from the cache. Eviction removes entries from the cache when it reaches a configured threshold.
cache-metrics.current-number-entries-tooltip: Displays the number of entries that are stored in the cache. Each entry is counted only once so the number does not include replicas.
cache-metrics.min-nodes-tooltip: Displays the number of nodes that must remain in the cluster to avoid data loss.
cache-metrics.cache-size-off-heap: Size of cache in off-heap memory
cache-metrics.cache-size-off-heap-tooltip: Displays the amount of off-heap memory that data in the cache uses. Total memory usage is higher because it includes internal data structures.
cache-metrics.cache-size-heap: Size of cache in heap memory
cache-metrics.cache-size-heap-tooltip: Displays the amount of JVM heap memory that data in the cache uses. Total memory usage is higher because it includes internal data structures.
